name: General - Re-Specing and Giving Player Pokemon

system.effect:
GM NOTE: Giving Players Pokémon and Re-Specing Pokémon

    When you (as a GM) make a Pokémon available to the party, it is strongly advised that in every case, you allow the player to reallocate stats, and determine which Nature, Abilities, and Moves the Pokémon should have upon them catching or receiving the Pokémon.

    Generally speaking, this strong recommendation is to minimize the adversarial GM/Player relationship that the PTU Core Rules frequently fostered with its rules and guidance over the years. So to new GMs, this is what we recommend. Experienced GMs and players can choose to roll with "set as they were when caught" that the video games do, but that requires an explicit understanding of the rules and mechanics of PTR, and explicit and understandable consent between the GM and their players about those terms.
